text: hello hi I want to talk to you today
about two vitamins that are important
for many women with PCOS that's vitamin
b12 and vitamin D now this information
is just for you to take with you and try
to fit in to your own health puzzle with
all supplements I recommend that you
take this information and present it to
your doctor or another healthcare
provider like a nutritionist or a
naturopath or do more research on your
own so you make sure that these choices
are right for you this is general
information to help you get started okay
so let's move on to vitamin b12 so why I
think that this is an important vitamin
for women with PCOS to be aware of it is
because long-term use of metformin the
drug that is commonly prescribed to them
with PCOS for insulin resistance it has
been shown again and again to cause low
vitamin b12 and people who use it long
term and some birth control pills also
cause low vitamin b12 particularly when
it's in combination with metformin so if
you are on metformin it's my
recommendation that you ask your doctor
to check you annually every year to see
if you have low b12 if you find it you
have low b12 or your physician things
that you should go ahead and start
supplementing with it since you're
taking metformin you can start usually
with just a hundred a hundred percent of
the daily recommended value one thing to
be aware of is that some people have
what's called the nth F R gene variant
it's a complicated thing that I'm not
I'm gonna get into right now it's just
to know that you may have trouble
breaking down vitamins in particular b12
is one of them if you have this gene
variant I happen to have it myself so
when I tested positive for that my
physician put me on a methylated b12
supplement that was appropriate for my
level
of b12 deficiency okay moving on to
vitamin D so vitamin D is a tricky one
because you can't get it from your diet
you have to get it from sun exposure and
most of us aren't getting a whole lot of
sun exposure maybe if you're unlike a
surf instructor you're getting some sun
exposure but anyway in some research 67
to 85 percent of women with PCOS were
found to be vitamin D deficient and
that's a problem because low vitamin D
is associated with fertility problems
cardiovascular disease her Sioux ISM
insulin resistance so if you are low in
vitamin D you could be aggravating all
of those problems that already come
along with having PCOS in fact some
studies have seen that women's with PCOS
see an improvement in their pursue ISM
infertility and cardiovascular factors
when they start taking a vitamin D
supplement now as far as I can tell in
the research there's no like one
particular vitamin D dosage for PCOS
right now a lot of people at experts are
kind of thinking that the daily
recommended value that we have currently
in the supplement industry isn't high
enough and so I'm reading just in my own
research that a good place to start is
about 2,000 international units of
vitamin D particularly d3 and with all
vitamins you want to look for vitamins
from reputable sources that are either
NSF or GMP certified those are consumer
watchdogs for supplements so they test
the purity of a supplement to brands
that I recommend or Sarah logics which I
have a brand partnership I love their
brand and another brand that I've been
happy with it so available sometimes on
Amazon is pure encapsulations both of
those brands
have multiple levels of quality control
so that you can trust what you're
getting okay
so vitamin b12 and vitamin D it's
probably a good idea to get yourself
checked annually for your levels
especially if you're taking metformin
and birth control pills you might even
want to look into whether or not you
have the nth fr gene variant and you can
actually take a test on the 23andme comm
for that if you want to all right

wisely ladies
